text: <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits anti-IgM induced proliferation of human B cells

The effects of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on normal and neoplastic hematopoietic cells prompted us to investigate the effects of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on normal human B cells .
All experiments in this study were performed under serum-free conditions as FCS has been shown to interfere with BMP-signalling [ 14 ] ( own observations ) .

To study the effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on proliferation , B-cells from healthy volunteers were stimulated with anti-IgM and / or <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the presence or absence of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for three days .
We found that <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> led to a 35 % mean reduction of anti-IgM - induced DNA synthesis ( n = 8 ; p < = 0.0002 , Figure 1A ) .
Similar results were obtained for B cells treated with anti-IgM and <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( 26 % mean reduction , n = 6 ; p < = 0.023 ) .

The <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced inhibition of proliferation was dose - dependent in both peripheral B cells ( Figure 1B ) and the Burkitt lymphoma cell line Ramos ( 40 % reduction of DNA synthesis , Figure 1C ) .
The <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> effects could be reversed by addition of the extracellular inhibitor <extra_id_0> Noggin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Figure 1D ) .

Similarly , a combination of the soluble BMP receptors <extra_id_0> BMP-RIB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Fc and <extra_id_0> BMP-RII <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Fc also neutralized the effects of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( data not shown ) .
Next , we wanted to test whether <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had different effect on naive and memory B cells .

Naive ( <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ) and memory ( <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + ) B cells were isolated from peripheral blood by cell sorting of immunobead-isolated <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + B cells [ 15 ] , and tested for their capacity to proliferate in the presence of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

However , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited anti-IgM induced DNA synthesis in the two subpopulations to a similar extent , with a mean reduction of DNA - synthesis of 45 % ( n = 5 ; p < = 0 , 004 ) for naive B cells and 48 % ( n = 5 ; p < = 0 , 001 ) for memory B cells ( Figure 1E ) .
